ðŸŒŸ savr | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Saving online content for offline reading and later access.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Save articles for reading later â€¢ Remove distractions like advertisements â€¢ Offline content including images â€¢ No dependency on a service/company for scraping or storage
ðŸ“– Summary: Savr is a progressive web app (PWA) for saving online content to read later, emphasizing offline access and user data control. It functions as a 'read it later' service that allows users to save articles and other online content for offline viewing, removing distractions like advertisements. Savr can be used as a hosted service or self-hosted, and it supports optional authorization and cross-device synchronization via Dropbox or Google Drive.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ s3sync | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Synchronizing large numbers of small files to and from S3-compatible storage with high speed and efficiency.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-threaded file downloading/uploading â€¢ S3 to local FS sync â€¢ Local FS to S3 sync â€¢ S3 to S3 sync â€¢ Retrying on errors
ðŸ“– Summary: S3Sync is a Go-based tool designed for high-speed synchronization of files to and from S3-compatible storage. It supports multi-threaded uploading/downloading and offers flexible filtering options, making it suitable for managing large numbers of small files. It can sync between S3 and local filesystems, or directly between S3 buckets.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ RustedLessPass | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Securely generating and managing passwords without needing to remember individual passwords for each site.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ LessPass Compatibility â€¢ WebAssembly Power â€¢ Cross-Platform Access â€¢ Open-Source Transparency
ðŸ“– Summary: RustedLessPass is a standalone password manager written in Rust and WebAssembly, compatible with LessPass. It allows users to generate and manage passwords securely without server-side dependencies, offering a platform-independent solution accessible through any modern web browser.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ dockrtui | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing Docker containers, images, networks, volumes, and Compose projects through a terminal-based user interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Containers, Images, Networks, Volumes & Compose management â€¢ Quick actions (start, stop, restart, inspect, prune) â€¢ Smart search and filtering â€¢ Built-in shell inside containers â€¢ Compose integration
ðŸ“– Summary: DockrTUI is a terminal dashboard for Docker, built with Rust and Ratatui, designed for managing containers, images, networks, volumes, and Compose projects. It provides a keyboard-driven interface for quick actions like starting, stopping, restarting, and inspecting Docker resources, aiming to simplify Docker management.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ pipedash | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Centralized management and monitoring of CI/CD pipelines from multiple providers.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ View pipeline status across multiple providers â€¢ Browse run history with commit info and execution times â€¢ Trigger workflows with parameters dynamically loaded from each provider â€¢ Re-run previous executions with the same parameters â€¢ Cancel running builds
ðŸ“– Summary: Pipedash is a desktop application designed to aggregate and manage CI/CD pipelines from multiple providers like GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Buildkite, Jenkins, Tekton CD, and ArgoCD into a single interface. It allows users to view pipeline statuses, browse run history, trigger workflows, and manage builds across different platforms from one central location.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ lazyssh | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing SSH connections and configurations through a terminal-based UI.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Server Management (add, edit, delete, pin, ping) â€¢ Quick Server Navigation (fuzzy search, one-keypress SSH, tagging, sorting) â€¢ Advanced SSH Configuration (port forwarding, connection multiplexing, advanced authentication, security settings, proxy settings)
ðŸ“– Summary: Lazyssh is a terminal-based SSH manager that simplifies server management by providing an interactive UI for connecting to servers defined in the user's `~/.ssh/config` file. It allows users to quickly navigate, connect, manage, and transfer files between their local machine and servers, eliminating the need to remember IP addresses or run long scp commands.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
